CLASS zcl_find_employees IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD find_employees_without_subordinates.
    DATA: lt_supervisors TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-supervisor_id,
          lt_employees   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zemp_master-employee_id,
          lt_names       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.

    SELECT supervisor_id FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_supervisors.
    SELECT employee_id FROM zemp_master INTO TABLE @lt_employees.

    LOOP AT lt_employees INTO DATA(lv_employee).
      READ TABLE lt_supervisors WITH KEY table_line = lv_employee TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        SELECT name FROM zemp_master INTO TABLE @lt_names WHERE employee_id = @lv_employee.
        APPEND LINES OF lt_names TO rt_employees.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

Create an ABAP class with a static method that calculates the number of direct subordinates for a given supervisor based on input data.
Use this database:
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

Input:
supervisor_id type char20
Output:
amount type i

Example:
Input:
DATA(lt_org_data) = VALUE zorg_hierarchy( 
  ( employee_id = 'E1' supervisor_id = 'M1' )
  ( employee_id = 'E2' supervisor_id = 'M1' )
  ( employee_id = 'E3' supervisor_id = 'M2' )
  ( employee_id = 'M1' supervisor_id = 'CEO' )
  ( employee_id = 'M2' supervisor_id = 'CEO' ) ).
Output:
DATA(lv_result) = zcl_example=>count_subordinates( iv_supervisor_id = 'M1' ). => 2

CLASS zcl_example DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      count_subordinates
        IMPORTING
          iv_supervisor_id TYPE char20
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_amount) TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_example IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD count_subordinates.
    DATA: lt_org_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_org_data.

    rv_amount = 0.
    LOOP AT lt_org_data INTO DATA(ls_org_data).
      IF ls_org_data-supervisor_id = iv_supervisor_id.
        rv_amount = rv_amount + 1.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

Write an abap class with a static method that determines the management chain of an employee in a hierarchical organization. 
The method should return a list of manager IDs starting from the direct manager of the given employee up to the top-level manager (e.g., CEO).
Use this database:
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

Input: 
employee_id type char20
Output: 
supervisor_ids type stringtab

Example:
Input:
DATA(zorg_data) = VALUE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_hierarchy WITH EMPTY KEY (
  ( employee_id = 'A' manager_id = 'B' )
  ( employee_id = 'B' manager_id = 'C' )
  ( employee_id = 'C' manager_id = 'D' )
  ( employee_id = 'D' manager_id = 'CEO' )
). 
INSERT zorg_hierarchy FROM TABLE @zorg_data.
Output: 
find_management_chain( iv_employee_id = 'A' ) => ['B', 'C', 'D', 'CEO']
find_management_chain( iv_employee_id = 'C' ) => ['D', 'CEO']
find_management_chain( iv_employee_id = 'CEO' ) => []

CLASS lcl_management_chain DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      find_management_chain
        IMPORTING
          iv_employee_id        TYPE char20
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_supervisor_ids) TYPE stringtab.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_management_chain IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD find_management_chain.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lv_supervisor_id  TYPE char20,
          lv_found          TYPE abap_bool.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.

    rv_supervisor_ids = VALUE #( ).

    lv_supervisor_id = iv_employee_id.
    DO.
      READ TABLE lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure) WITH KEY employee_id = lv_supervisor_id.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id TO rv_supervisor_ids.
      lv_supervisor_id = ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id.
      IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = 'CEO'.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
    ENDDO.

  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_management_chain DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      find_management_chain
        IMPORTING
          iv_employee_id        TYPE char20
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rt_supervisor_ids) TYPE stringtab.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_management_chain IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD find_management_chain.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lv_supervisor_id TYPE char20,
          lv_found         TYPE abap_bool.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.

    rt_supervisor_ids = VALUE #( ).

    lv_supervisor_id = iv_employee_id.
    DO.
      lv_found = abap_false.
      LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_zorg_structure>).
        IF <ls_zorg_structure>-employee_id = lv_supervisor_id.
          APPEND <ls_zorg_structure>-supervisor_id TO rt_supervisor_ids.
          lv_supervisor_id = <ls_zorg_structure>-supervisor_id.
          lv_found = abap_true.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lv_found = abap_false.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
    ENDDO.

    DELETE rt_supervisor_ids WHERE table_line = iv_employee_id.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

Write an abap class with a static method that determines the management chain of an employee in a hierarchical organization.

define table zorg_structure {

DATA(zorg_data) = VALUE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_hierarchy WITH EMPTY KEY (

CLASS lcl_management_chain DEFINITION.

  METHOD find_management_chain.

      READ TABLE lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure) WITH KEY employee_id = lv_supervisor_id.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.

ENDCLASS.

You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.

System Environment

Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code.

Write an abap class with a static method that determines the management chain of an employee in a hierarchical organization. 
The method should return a list of manager IDs starting from the direct manager of the given employee up to the top-level manager (e.g., CEO).
Use this database:
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

Input: 
employee_id type char20
Output: 
supervisor_ids type stringtab

Example:
Input:
DATA(zorg_data) = VALUE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_hierarchy WITH EMPTY KEY (
  ( employee_id = 'A' manager_id = 'B' )
  ( employee_id = 'B' manager_id = 'C' )
  ( employee_id = 'C' manager_id = 'D' )
  ( employee_id = 'D' manager_id = 'CEO' )
). 
INSERT zorg_hierarchy FROM TABLE @zorg_data.
Output: 
find_management_chain( iv_employee_id = 'A' ) => ['B', 'C', 'D', 'CEO']
find_management_chain( iv_employee_id = 'C' ) => ['D', 'CEO']
find_management_chain( iv_employee_id = 'CEO' ) => []

CLASS lcl_management_chain DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      find_management_chain
        IMPORTING
          iv_employee_id        TYPE char20
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rt_supervisor_ids) TYPE stringtab.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_management_chain IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD find_management_chain.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lv_supervisor_id TYPE zorg_structure-supervisor_id,
          lv_employee_id   TYPE zorg_structure-employee_id.

    lv_employee_id = iv_employee_id.

    WHILE lv_employee_id IS NOT INITIAL.
      SELECT SINGLE supervisor_id FROM zorg_structure INTO lv_supervisor_id
        WHERE employee_id = lv_employee_id.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        APPEND lv_supervisor_id TO rt_supervisor_ids.
        lv_employee_id = lv_supervisor_id.
      ELSE.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
    ENDWHILE.

  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

Implement an abap class with a static method that checks if the employee hierarchy is valid. 
The method should:
- Read all entries from ZORG_STRUCTURE.
- Return abap_true if the organizational structure satisfies all of the following:
   - Each employee has at most one direct manager.
   - There are no cycles in the manager relationships.
   - There is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager.
   - All employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO.
- Return abap_false otherwise.
Use this table: 
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

Example:
Input:
DATA(zorg_entries) = VALUE zorg_structure ( 
  ( employee_id = 'A' superior_id = 'B' )
  ( employee_id = 'B' superior_id = 'C' )
  ( employee_id = 'C' superior_id = 'D' )
)
INSERT zorg_structure FROM TABLE @zorg_structure.
Output:
DATA(result) = zcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
" result = abap_true.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_valid) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_employees      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_managers       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lv_ceo            TYPE abap_char(20),
          lv_count          TYPE i,
          lv_valid          TYPE abap_bool.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      READ TABLE lt_employees WITH KEY table_line = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        rv_valid = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_employees.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check there are no cycles in the manager relationships
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      DATA: lt_path TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_path.
      DATA: lv_current_employee TYPE abap_char(20) VALUE ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
      WHILE TRUE.
        READ TABLE lt_zorg_structure WITH KEY employee_id = lv_current_employee INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure2).
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.
        lv_current_employee = ls_zorg_structure2-supervisor_id.
        READ TABLE lt_path WITH KEY table_line = lv_current_employee TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          rv_valid = abap_false.
          RETURN.
        ENDIF.
        APPEND lv_current_employee TO lt_path.
      ENDWHILE.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check there is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id TO lt_managers.
    ENDLOOP.
    SORT lt_employees.
    SORT lt_managers.
    DELETE lt_employees WHERE table_line IN lt_managers.
    IF lines( lt_employees ) <> 1.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.
    lv_ceo = lt_employees[ 1 ].

    " Check all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    DATA: lt_connected_employees TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).
    APPEND lv_ceo TO lt_connected_employees.
    WHILE TRUE.
      DATA: lv_new_employees TYPE i.
      LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
        IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id IN lt_connected_employees AND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id NOT IN lt_connected_employees.
          APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_connected_employees.
          lv_new_employees = lv_new_employees + 1.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lv_new_employees = 0.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
    ENDWHILE.
    IF lines( lt_connected_employees ) <> lines( lt_zorg_structure ).
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    rv_valid = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_valid) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    rv_valid = lcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

Implement an abap class with a static method that checks if the employee hierarchy is valid. 
The method should:
- Read all entries from ZORG_STRUCTURE.
- Return abap_true if the organizational structure satisfies all of the following:
   - Each employee has at most one direct manager.
   - There are no cycles in the manager relationships.
   - There is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager.
   - All employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO.
- Return abap_false otherwise.
Use this table: 
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

Example:
Input:
DATA(zorg_entries) = VALUE zorg_structure ( 
  ( employee_id = 'A' superior_id = 'B' )
  ( employee_id = 'B' superior_id = 'C' )
  ( employee_id = 'C' superior_id = 'D' )
)
INSERT zorg_structure FROM TABLE @zorg_structure.
Output:
DATA(result) = zcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
" result = abap_true.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_valid) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_employees      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_managers       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lv_ceo            TYPE abap_char(20),
          lv_count          TYPE i,
          lv_valid          TYPE abap_bool.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      COLLECT ls_zorg_structure-employee_id INTO lt_employees.
      COLLECT ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id INTO lt_managers.
    ENDLOOP.
    SORT lt_employees.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_employees.
    SORT lt_managers.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_managers.
    LOOP AT lt_employees INTO DATA(lv_employee).
      lv_count = 0.
      LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
        IF ls_zorg_structure-employee_id = lv_employee.
          lv_count = lv_count + 1.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lv_count > 1.
        rv_valid = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check there are no cycles in the manager relationships
    DATA: lt_visited TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_stack   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).
    LOOP AT lt_managers INTO DATA(lv_manager).
      IF lv_manager NOT IN lt_employees.
        lv_ceo = lv_manager.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lv_ceo IS INITIAL.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.
    APPEND lv_ceo TO lt_stack.
    WHILE lt_stack IS NOT INITIAL.
      DATA(lv_current) = lt_stack[ 1 ].
      DELETE lt_stack INDEX 1.
      IF lv_current IN lt_visited.
        rv_valid = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND lv_current TO lt_visited.
      LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
        IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = lv_current.
          APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_stack.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.

    " Check there is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager
    IF lines( lt_managers ) - lines( lt_employees ) <> 1.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    IF lines( lt_employees ) <> lines( lt_visited ) - 1.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    rv_valid = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_valid) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    rv_valid = lcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

Implement an abap class with a static method that checks if the employee hierarchy is valid. 
The method should:
- Read all entries from ZORG_STRUCTURE.
- Return abap_true if the organizational structure satisfies all of the following:
   - Each employee has at most one direct manager.
   - There are no cycles in the manager relationships.
   - There is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager.
   - All employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO.
- Return abap_false otherwise.
Use this table: 
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

Example:
Input:
DATA(zorg_entries) = VALUE zorg_structure ( 
  ( employee_id = 'A' superior_id = 'B' )
  ( employee_id = 'B' superior_id = 'C' )
  ( employee_id = 'C' superior_id = 'D' )
)
INSERT zorg_structure FROM TABLE @zorg_structure.
Output:
DATA(result) = zcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
" result = abap_true.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_result) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_employees      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_managers       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_ceos           TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lv_employee       TYPE abap_char(20),
          lv_manager        TYPE abap_char(20),
          lv_count          TYPE i,
          lv_ceo_count      TYPE i.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check if each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      lv_employee = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
      lv_manager = ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id.
      READ TABLE lt_employees INTO DATA(lv_employee_exists) WITH KEY table_line = lv_employee.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        rv_result = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND lv_employee TO lt_employees.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check for cycles in the manager relationships
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      lv_employee = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
      lv_manager = ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id.
      DATA(lt_path) = VALUE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20) ( lv_employee ).
      DATA(lv_cycle) = abap_false.
      WHILE lv_manager IS NOT INITIAL.
        READ TABLE lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure_manager) WITH KEY employee_id = lv_manager.
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.
        lv_manager = ls_zorg_structure_manager-supervisor_id.
        READ TABLE lt_path INTO DATA(lv_path_exists) WITH KEY table_line = lv_manager.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          lv_cycle = abap_true.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.
        APPEND lv_manager TO lt_path.
      ENDWHILE.
      IF lv_cycle = abap_true.
        rv_result = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check for exactly one top-level manager (CEO)
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      lv_manager = ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id.
      READ TABLE lt_managers INTO DATA(lv_manager_exists) WITH KEY table_line = lv_manager.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND lv_manager TO lt_managers.
    ENDLOOP.
    LOOP AT lt_managers INTO lv_manager.
      READ TABLE lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure WITH KEY supervisor_id = lv_manager.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        APPEND lv_manager TO lt_ceos.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    lv_ceo_count = lines( lt_ceos ).
    IF lv_ceo_count <> 1.
      rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check if all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    DATA(lv_ceo) = lt_ceos[ 1 ].
    DATA(lt_connected_employees) = VALUE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20) ( ).
    APPEND lv_ceo TO lt_connected_employees.
    DATA(lt_new_employees) = VALUE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20) ( ).
    APPEND lv_ceo TO lt_new_employees.
    WHILE lines( lt_new_employees ) > 0.
      CLEAR lt_new_employees.
      LOOP AT lt_connected_employees INTO lv_employee.
        LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
          IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = lv_employee.
            READ TABLE lt_connected_employees INTO lv_employee_exists WITH KEY table_line = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
            IF sy-subrc <> 0.
              APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_connected_employees.
              APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_new_employees.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.
        ENDLOOP.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.
    IF lines( lt_connected_employees ) <> lines( lt_zorg_structure ).
      rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    rv_result = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_result) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    rv_result = lcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_employees      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_managers       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lv_ceo            TYPE abap_char(20),

    IF sy-subrc <> 0.

    ENDIF.

    " Check each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      READ TABLE lt_employees WITH KEY table_line = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.

        RETURN.

      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_employees.

    " Check there are no cycles in the manager relationships
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.

      lv_employee = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
      lv_manager  = ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id.

      RETURNING

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_employees      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_managers       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_ceos           TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lv_ceo            TYPE abap_char(20),
          lv_valid          TYPE abap_bool.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_employees.
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id TO lt_managers.
    ENDLOOP.

    SORT lt_employees.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_employees.
    SORT lt_managers.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_managers.

    " Check if each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      DATA(lv_count) = 0.
      LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure2).
        IF ls_zorg_structure-employee_id = ls_zorg_structure2-employee_id.
          lv_count = lv_count + 1.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lv_count > 1.
        rv_valid = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check if there are no cycles in the manager relationships
    DATA: lt_visited TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_stack   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).

    LOOP AT lt_employees INTO DATA(lv_employee).
      IF NOT line_exists( lt_visited[ table_line = lv_employee ] ).
        lt_stack = VALUE #( ( lv_employee ) ).
        lt_visited = VALUE #( ( lv_employee ) ).

        WHILE lt_stack IS NOT INITIAL.
          DATA(lv_current) = lt_stack[ table_line = lines( lt_stack ) ].
          DELETE lt_stack INDEX lines( lt_stack ).

          LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
            IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = lv_current.
              DATA(lv_next) = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
              IF line_exists( lt_stack[ table_line = lv_next ] ).
                rv_valid = abap_false.
                RETURN.
              ENDIF.
              IF NOT line_exists( lt_visited[ table_line = lv_next ] ).
                APPEND lv_next TO lt_stack.
                APPEND lv_next TO lt_visited.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.
          ENDLOOP.
        ENDWHILE.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check if there is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager
    LOOP AT lt_managers INTO DATA(lv_manager).
      IF NOT line_exists( lt_employees[ table_line = lv_manager ] ).
        APPEND lv_manager TO lt_ceos.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    IF lines( lt_ceos ) <> 1.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    lv_ceo = lt_ceos[ 1 ].

    " Check if all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    lt_visited = VALUE #( ).
    lt_stack = VALUE #( ( lv_ceo ) ).
    lt_visited = VALUE #( ( lv_ceo ) ).

    WHILE lt_stack IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_current = lt_stack[ table_line = lines( lt_stack ) ].
      DELETE lt_stack INDEX lines( lt_stack ).

      LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
        IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = lv_current.
          DATA(lv_next) = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
          IF NOT line_exists( lt_visited[ table_line = lv_next ] ).
            APPEND lv_next TO lt_stack.
            APPEND lv_next TO lt_visited.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.

    IF lines( lt_visited ) = lines( lt_employees ).
      rv_valid = abap_true.
    ELSE.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
    ENDIF.

    rv_valid = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_valid) TYPE abap_bool.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_org_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_employees     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_managers      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_ceos          TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lv_ceo           TYPE abap_char(20),
          lv_valid         TYPE abap_bool.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_org_structure.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_org_structure INTO DATA(ls_org).
      APPEND ls_org-employee_id TO lt_employees.
      APPEND ls_org-supervisor_id TO lt_managers.
    ENDLOOP.
    SORT lt_employees.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_employees.
    SORT lt_managers.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_managers.

    DATA: lt_employee_managers TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure.
    LOOP AT lt_employees INTO DATA(lv_employee).
      LOOP AT lt_org_structure INTO ls_org.
        IF ls_org-employee_id = lv_employee.
          APPEND ls_org TO lt_employee_managers.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lines( lt_employee_managers ) > 1.
        rv_valid = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
      CLEAR lt_employee_managers.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check there are no cycles in the manager relationships
    DATA: lt_visited TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_stack   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).
    LOOP AT lt_managers INTO DATA(lv_manager).
      IF NOT line_exists( lt_visited[ table_line = lv_manager ] ).
        PERFORM check_cycle USING lt_org_structure lt_visited lt_stack lv_manager CHANGING lv_valid.
        IF lv_valid = abap_false.
          rv_valid = abap_false.
          RETURN.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check there is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager
    LOOP AT lt_managers INTO lv_manager.
      READ TABLE lt_employees INTO DATA(lv_employee) WITH KEY table_line = lv_manager.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        APPEND lv_manager TO lt_ceos.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lines( lt_ceos ) <> 1.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.
    lv_ceo = lt_ceos[ 1 ].

    " Check all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    DATA: lt_connected_employees TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).
    PERFORM get_connected_employees USING lt_org_structure lt_connected_employees lv_ceo.
    IF lines( lt_connected_employees ) <> lines( lt_employees ).
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    rv_valid = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

FORM check_cycle
  USING
    it_org_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure
    it_visited       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20)
    it_stack         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20)
    iv_manager       TYPE abap_char(20)
  CHANGING
    cv_valid         TYPE abap_bool.
  DATA: lv_manager TYPE abap_char(20).
  APPEND iv_manager TO it_visited.
  APPEND iv_manager TO it_stack.
  LOOP AT it_org_structure INTO DATA(ls_org).
    IF ls_org-supervisor_id = iv_manager.
      lv_manager = ls_org-employee_id.
      IF line_exists( it_stack[ table_line = lv_manager ] ).
        cv_valid = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
      IF NOT line_exists( it_visited[ table_line = lv_manager ] ).
        PERFORM check_cycle USING it_org_structure it_visited it_stack lv_manager CHANGING cv_valid.
        IF cv_valid = abap_false.
          RETURN.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  DELETE it_stack INDEX lines( it_stack ).
ENDFORM.

FORM get_connected_employees
  USING
    it_org_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure
    ct_connected_employees TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20)
    iv_manager       TYPE abap_char(20).
  DATA: lv_manager TYPE abap_char(20).
  APPEND iv_manager TO ct_connected_employees.
  LOOP AT it_org_structure INTO DATA(ls_org).
    IF ls_org-supervisor_id = iv_manager AND NOT line_exists( ct_connected_employees[ table_line = ls_org-employee_id ] ).
      PERFORM get_connected_employees USING it_org_structure ct_connected_employees ls_org-employee_id.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

            RETURN.
          ENDIF.
          APPEND lv_current TO lt_visited.
          LOOP AT lt_org_structure INTO ls_org_structure.
            IF ls_org_structure-supervisor_id = lv_current.
              APPEND ls_org_structure-employee_id TO lt_stack.
            ENDIF.
          ENDLOOP.
        ENDWHILE.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check if there is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager
    LOOP AT lt_managers INTO lv_manager.
      IF NOT line_exists( lt_employees[ table_line = lv_manager ] ).
        APPEND lv_manager TO lt_ceos.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lines( lt_ceos ) <> 1.
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.
    lv_ceo = lt_ceos[ 1 ].

    " Check if all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    DATA: lt_connected_employees TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).
    APPEND lv_ceo TO lt_connected_employees.
    DATA: lt_new_employees TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20).
    DO.
      CLEAR lt_new_employees.
      LOOP AT lt_org_structure INTO ls_org_structure.
        IF line_exists( lt_connected_employees[ table_line = ls_org_structure-supervisor_id ] )
          AND NOT line_exists( lt_connected_employees[ table_line = ls_org_structure-employee_id ] ).
          APPEND ls_org_structure-employee_id TO lt_new_employees.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lines( lt_new_employees ) = 0.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND LINES OF lt_new_employees TO lt_connected_employees.
    ENDDO.
    IF lines( lt_connected_employees ) <> lines( lt_employees ).
      rv_valid = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    rv_valid = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_valid) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    rv_valid = lcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Implement an abap class with a static method that checks if the employee hierarchy is valid. 
The method should:
- Read all entries from ZORG_STRUCTURE.
- Return abap_true if the organizational structure satisfies all of the following:
   - Each employee has at most one direct manager.
   - There are no cycles in the manager relationships.
   - There is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager.
   - All employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO.
- Return abap_false otherwise.
Use this table: 
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

Example:
Input:
DATA(zorg_entries) = VALUE zorg_structure ( 
  ( employee_id = 'A' superior_id = 'B' )
  ( employee_id = 'B' superior_id = 'C' )
  ( employee_id = 'C' superior_id = 'D' )
)
INSERT zorg_structure FROM TABLE @zorg_structure.
Output:
DATA(result) = zcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
" result = abap_true.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_result) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_managers       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id,
          lt_employees      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id,
          lv_ceo            TYPE zorg_structure-employee_id,
          lv_count          TYPE i.

    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      COLLECT ls_zorg_structure-employee_id INTO lt_employees.
      COLLECT ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id INTO lt_managers.
    ENDLOOP.
    SORT lt_employees.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_employees.
    SORT lt_managers.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_managers.

    LOOP AT lt_employees INTO DATA(ls_employee).
      lv_count = 0.
      LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
        IF ls_zorg_structure-employee_id = ls_employee.
          lv_count = lv_count + 1.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lv_count > 1.
        rv_result = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check there are no cycles in the manager relationships
    DATA: lt_visited TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id,
          lt_stack   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id.

    LOOP AT lt_managers INTO DATA(ls_manager).
      IF ls_manager NOT IN lt_employees.
        lv_ceo = ls_manager.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    IF lines( lt_managers ) <> lines( lt_employees ) + 1.
      rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    PERFORM check_cycle USING lt_zorg_structure lt_visited lt_stack lv_ceo CHANGING rv_result.
    IF rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    PERFORM check_connection USING lt_zorg_structure lt_employees lv_ceo CHANGING rv_result.
    IF rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    rv_result = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

FORM check_cycle
  USING
    it_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure
    it_visited       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id
    it_stack         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id
    iv_ceo           TYPE zorg_structure-employee_id
  CHANGING
    cv_result        TYPE abap_bool.

  DATA: lv_current TYPE zorg_structure-employee_id.

  lv_current = iv_ceo.
  APPEND lv_current TO it_stack.
  APPEND lv_current TO it_visited.

  WHILE lines( it_stack ) > 0.
    lv_current = it_stack[ lines( it_stack ) ].
    DELETE it_stack INDEX lines( it_stack ).

    LOOP AT it_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = lv_current AND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id NOT IN it_visited.
        APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO it_stack.
        APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO it_visited.
      ELSEIF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = lv_current AND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id IN it_stack.
        cv_result = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDWHILE.
ENDFORM.

FORM check_connection
  USING
    it_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure
    it_employees     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id
    iv_ceo           TYPE zorg_structure-employee_id
  CHANGING
    cv_result        TYPE abap_bool.

  DATA: lt_visited TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id,
        lt_stack   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure-employee_id.

  APPEND iv_ceo TO lt_stack.
  APPEND iv_ceo TO lt_visited.

  WHILE lines( lt_stack ) > 0.
    DATA(lv_current) = lt_stack[ lines( lt_stack ) ].
    DELETE lt_stack INDEX lines( lt_stack ).

    LOOP AT it_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      IF ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id = lv_current AND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id NOT IN lt_visited.
        APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_stack.
        APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_visited.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDWHILE.

  SORT it_employees.
  SORT lt_visited.
  IF it_employees <> lt_visited.
    cv_result = abap_false.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

Implement an abap class with a static method that checks if the employee hierarchy is valid. 
The method should:
- Read all entries from ZORG_STRUCTURE.
- Return abap_true if the organizational structure satisfies all of the following:
   - Each employee has at most one direct manager.
   - There are no cycles in the manager relationships.
   - There is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager.
   - All employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO.
- Return abap_false otherwise.
Use this table: 
define table zorg_structure {
    key employee_id   : abap.char(20) not null;
    key supervisor_id : abap.char(20) not null;
}

DATA(zorg_entries) = VALUE zorg_structure (

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_result) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    DATA: lt_zorg_structure TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zorg_structure,
          lt_employees      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lt_managers       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char(20),
          lv_ceo            TYPE abap_char(20),
          lv_count          TYPE i,
          lv_result         TYPE abap_bool.

    " Read all entries from ZORG_STRUCTURE
    SELECT * FROM zorg_structure INTO TABLE @lt_zorg_structure.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    " Check if each employee has at most one direct manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_zorg_structure).
      READ TABLE lt_employees INTO DATA(ls_employee) WITH KEY table_line = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        rv_result = abap_false.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-employee_id TO lt_employees.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check if there are no cycles in the manager relationships
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      DATA(lv_current_employee) = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
      DATA(lv_current_manager) = ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id.
      WHILE lv_current_manager IS NOT INITIAL.
        IF lv_current_employee = lv_current_manager.
          rv_result = abap_false.
          RETURN.
        ENDIF.
        READ TABLE lt_zorg_structure INTO DATA(ls_current_manager) WITH KEY employee_id = lv_current_manager.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          lv_current_employee = lv_current_manager.
          lv_current_manager = ls_current_manager-supervisor_id.
        ELSE.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.
      ENDWHILE.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Check if there is exactly one top-level manager (a "CEO") without a manager
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      APPEND ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id TO lt_managers.
    ENDLOOP.
    SORT lt_employees.
    SORT lt_managers.
    DELETE lt_employees WHERE table_line IN lt_managers.
    IF lines( lt_employees ) <> 1.
      rv_result = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.
    lv_ceo = lt_employees[ 1 ].

    " Check if all employees are directly or indirectly connected to the CEO
    LOOP AT lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_zorg_structure.
      DATA(lv_current_employee) = ls_zorg_structure-employee_id.
      DATA(lv_current_manager) = ls_zorg_structure-supervisor_id.
      WHILE lv_current_manager IS NOT INITIAL.
        IF lv_current_manager = lv_ceo.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.
        READ TABLE lt_zorg_structure INTO ls_current_manager WITH KEY employee_id = lv_current_manager.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          lv_current_manager = ls_current_manager-supervisor_id.
        ELSE.
          rv_result = abap_false.
          RETURN.
        ENDIF.
      ENDWHILE.
    ENDLOOP.

    rv_result = abap_true.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils DEFINITION.
  CLASS-METHODS:
    is_valid_hierarchy
      RETURNING
        VALUE(rv_result) TYPE abap_bool.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_hierarchy_utils IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD is_valid_hierarchy.
    rv_result = lcl_hierarchy_utils=>is_valid_hierarchy( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

CLASS lcl_production_process DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      calculate_total_duration
        IMPORTING
          it_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data
          it_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_total_duration) TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    DATA: lt_graph TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_graph,
          ls_graph LIKE LINE OF lt_graph,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i,
          lt_in_degree TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i,
          ls_in_degree LIKE LINE OF lt_in_degree,
          lt_queue TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id,
          ls_queue LIKE LINE OF lt_queue,
          ls_step LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_graph,
             from_step TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
             to_step TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
           END OF ty_graph.

    " Build graph
    LOOP AT it_fnet_data INTO DATA(ls_fnet_data).
      ls_graph-from_step = ls_fnet_data-from_step.
      ls_graph-to_step = ls_fnet_data-to_step.
      APPEND ls_graph TO lt_graph.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Initialize in-degree
    LOOP AT it_fs_data INTO ls_step.
      READ TABLE lt_in_degree WITH KEY table_line = ls_step-step_id INTO ls_in_degree.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        APPEND ls_step-step_id TO lt_in_degree.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Calculate in-degree
    LOOP AT lt_graph INTO ls_graph.
      READ TABLE lt_in_degree WITH KEY table_line = ls_graph-to_step INTO ls_in_degree.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        ls_in_degree = ls_in_degree + 1.
        MODIFY lt_in_degree INDEX sy-tabix FROM ls_in_degree.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Initialize queue
    LOOP AT lt_in_degree INTO ls_in_degree.
      IF ls_in_degree = 0.
        READ TABLE it_fs_data WITH KEY step_id = ls_in_degree-table_line INTO ls_step.
        APPEND ls_step-step_id TO lt_queue.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Topological sorting
    WHILE lt_queue IS NOT INITIAL.
      READ TABLE lt_queue INTO ls_queue INDEX 1.
      DELETE lt_queue INDEX 1.
      READ TABLE it_fs_data WITH KEY step_id = ls_queue INTO ls_step.
      lv_total_duration = ls_step-duration.

      " Update total duration
      LOOP AT lt_graph INTO ls_graph.
        IF ls_graph-from_step = ls_queue.
          READ TABLE it_fs_data WITH KEY step_id = ls_graph-to_step INTO DATA(ls_to_step).
          lv_max_duration = lv_total_duration + ls_to_step-duration.
          IF lv_max_duration > lv_total_duration.
            lv_total_duration = lv_max_duration.
          ENDIF.
          READ TABLE lt_in_degree WITH KEY table_line = ls_graph-to_step INTO ls_in_degree.
          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            ls_in_degree = ls_in_degree - 1.
            MODIFY lt_in_degree INDEX sy-tabix FROM ls_in_degree.
            IF ls_in_degree = 0.
              APPEND ls_graph-to_step TO lt_queue.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.

    rv_total_duration = lv_total_duration.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

CLASS lcl_production_process DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      calculate_total_duration
        IMPORTING
          it_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data
          it_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_total_duration) TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    DATA: lt_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lt_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i,
          lt_in_degree TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i,
          lt_graph TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_edge,
          ls_edge LIKE LINE OF lt_graph,
          ls_node TYPE ty_node,
          lt_nodes TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_node,
          ls_in_degree LIKE LINE OF lt_in_degree,
          lv_node_id TYPE abap_char10,
          lv_duration TYPE i,
          lv_from_step TYPE abap_char10,
          lv_to_step TYPE abap_char10.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_edge,
             from_step TYPE abap_char10,
             to_step TYPE abap_char10,
           END OF ty_edge.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_node,
             step_id TYPE abap_char10,
             duration TYPE i,
             in_degree TYPE i,
             max_duration TYPE i,
           END OF ty_node.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_data> LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
                   <fnet_data> LIKE LINE OF it_fnet_data.

    lt_fs_data = it_fs_data.
    lt_fnet_data = it_fnet_data.

    LOOP AT lt_fs_data ASSIGNING <fs_data>.
      APPEND VALUE #( step_id = <fs_data>-step_id duration = <fs_data>-duration in_degree = 0 max_duration = <fs_data>-duration ) TO lt_nodes.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT lt_fnet_data ASSIGNING <fnet_data>.
      lv_from_step = <fnet_data>-from_step.
      lv_to_step = <fnet_data>-to_step.
      READ TABLE lt_nodes WITH KEY step_id = lv_to_step INTO ls_node.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        ls_node-in_degree = ls_node-in_degree + 1.
        MODIFY TABLE lt_nodes FROM ls_node.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT lt_fnet_data ASSIGNING <fnet_data>.
      lv_from_step = <fnet_data>-from_step.
      lv_to_step = <fnet_data>-to_step.
      APPEND VALUE #( from_step = lv_from_step to_step = lv_to_step ) TO lt_graph.
    ENDLOOP.

    DATA: lt_queue TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_node,
          ls_queue LIKE LINE OF lt_queue.

    LOOP AT lt_nodes INTO ls_node.
      IF ls_node-in_degree = 0.
        APPEND ls_node TO lt_queue.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    WHILE lt_queue IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE lt_queue INDEX 1 RECEIVING DATA(ls_queue).
      READ TABLE lt_graph INTO ls_edge WITH KEY from_step = ls_queue-step_id.
      WHILE sy-subrc = 0.
        READ TABLE lt_nodes WITH KEY step_id = ls_edge-to_step INTO ls_node.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          ls_node-max_duration = MAX( ls_node-max_duration ls_queue-max_duration + ls_node-duration ).
          ls_node-in_degree = ls_node-in_degree - 1.
          MODIFY TABLE lt_nodes FROM ls_node.
          IF ls_node-in_degree = 0.
            APPEND ls_node TO lt_queue.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
        DELETE lt_graph INDEX sy-tabix.
        READ TABLE lt_graph INTO ls_edge WITH KEY from_step = ls_queue-step_id.
      ENDWHILE.
    ENDWHILE.

    LOOP AT lt_nodes INTO ls_node.
      lv_max_duration = MAX( lv_max_duration ls_node-max_duration ).
    ENDLOOP.

    rv_total_duration = lv_max_duration.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.

CLASS lcl_production_process DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      calculate_total_duration
        IMPORTING
          it_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data
          it_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_total_duration) TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    DATA: lt_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lt_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i,
          ls_fs_data LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
          ls_fnet_data LIKE LINE OF it_fnet_data,
          lt_dependencies TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lt_independent_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lv_duration TYPE i.

    lt_fs_data = it_fs_data.
    lt_fnet_data = it_fnet_data.

    " Find all independent steps (steps with no dependencies)
    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      lv_duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      lt_dependencies = VALUE #( ( from_step = ls_fs_data-step_id ) ).
      DELETE lt_dependencies WHERE to_step IS INITIAL.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        APPEND ls_fs_data TO lt_independent_steps.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Calculate the total duration for each step
    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      lv_duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      lt_dependencies = VALUE #( ).
      LOOP AT lt_fnet_data INTO ls_fnet_data.
        IF ls_fnet_data-to_step = ls_fs_data-step_id.
          APPEND ls_fnet_data TO lt_dependencies.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lt_dependencies IS NOT INITIAL.
        LOOP AT lt_dependencies INTO ls_fnet_data.
          READ TABLE lt_fs_data INTO DATA(ls_dependency) WITH KEY step_id = ls_fnet_data-from_step.
          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            lv_duration = lv_duration + ls_dependency-duration.
          ENDIF.
        ENDLOOP.
      ENDIF.
      ls_fs_data-duration = lv_duration.
      MODIFY lt_fs_data FROM ls_fs_data.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Find the step with the maximum duration
    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      IF ls_fs_data-duration > lv_max_duration.
        lv_max_duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    rv_total_duration = lv_max_duration.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_production_process DEFINITION.

        IMPORTING
          it_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data
          it_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_total_duration) TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    DATA: lt_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lt_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i,
          lt_step_durations TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i,
          ls_fs_data LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
          ls_fnet_data LIKE LINE OF it_fnet_data,
          lt_dependencies TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lt_independent_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lv_step_id TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
          lv_duration TYPE zfs_data-duration.

    lt_fs_data = it_fs_data.
    lt_fnet_data = it_fnet_data.

    " Initialize step durations
    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      APPEND ls_fs_data-duration TO lt_step_durations.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Find independent steps
    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      lv_step_id = ls_fs_data-step_id.
      lv_duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      lt_dependencies = VALUE #( ( from_step = lv_step_id ) ).
      DELETE lt_dependencies WHERE from_step = lv_step_id.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        APPEND ls_fs_data TO lt_independent_steps.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Calculate total duration
    lv_total_duration = 0.
    LOOP AT lt_independent_steps INTO ls_fs_data.
      lv_step_id = ls_fs_data-step_id.
      lv_duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      lv_max_duration = lv_duration.
      " Perform DFS to find the longest path
      PERFORM dfs USING lt_fs_data lt_fnet_data lv_step_id lv_max_duration CHANGING lv_total_duration.
    ENDLOOP.

    rv_total_duration = lv_total_duration.

  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

FORM dfs USING it_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data
                  it_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data
                  iv_step_id TYPE zfs_data-step_id
                  iv_max_duration TYPE i
                  CHANGING cv_total_duration TYPE i.
  DATA: ls_fs_data LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
        ls_fnet_data LIKE LINE OF it_fnet_data,
        lv_duration TYPE zfs_data-duration,
        lv_next_step_id TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
        lv_next_max_duration TYPE i.

  " Find the current step's duration
  READ TABLE it_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data WITH KEY step_id = iv_step_id.
  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    lv_duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
  ENDIF.

  " Update the maximum duration
  iv_max_duration = iv_max_duration + lv_duration.

  " Find the next steps
  LOOP AT it_fnet_data INTO ls_fnet_data WHERE from_step = iv_step_id.
    lv_next_step_id = ls_fnet_data-to_step.
    lv_next_max_duration = iv_max_duration.
    PERFORM dfs USING it_fs_data it_fnet_data lv_next_step_id lv_next_max_duration CHANGING cv_total_duration.
  ENDLOOP.

  " Update the total duration
  IF iv_max_duration > cv_total_duration.
    cv_total_duration = iv_max_duration.
  ENDIF.

ENDFORM.

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    DATA: lt_fs_data  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lt_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i,
          lt_in_degree TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i,
          lt_graph TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_edge,
          lt_queue TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap.char(10).

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_edge,
             from_step TYPE abap.char(10),
             to_step  TYPE abap.char(10),
           END OF ty_edge.

    lt_fs_data = it_fs_data.
    lt_fnet_data = it_fnet_data.

    " Initialize in-degree and graph
    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO DATA(ls_fs_data).
      APPEND INITIAL LINE TO lt_in_degree ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_in_degree>).
      <ls_in_degree> = 0.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT lt_fnet_data INTO DATA(ls_fnet_data).
      APPEND VALUE #( from_step = ls_fnet_data-from_step to_step = ls_fnet_data-to_step ) TO lt_graph.
      READ TABLE lt_in_degree INTO DATA(ls_in_degree) INDEX sy-tabix.
      ls_in_degree = ls_in_degree + 1.
      MODIFY lt_in_degree INDEX sy-tabix FROM ls_in_degree.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Find all nodes with in-degree 0
    LOOP AT lt_in_degree INTO DATA(ls_in_degree2).
      IF ls_in_degree2 = 0.
        READ TABLE lt_fs_data INTO DATA(ls_fs_data2) INDEX sy-tabix.
        APPEND ls_fs_data2-step_id TO lt_queue.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Initialize distance
    DATA: lt_distance TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i.
    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      APPEND 0 TO lt_distance.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Process all nodes in the queue
    WHILE lt_queue IS NOT INITIAL.
      DATA(lv_step_id) = lt_queue[ 1 ].
      DELETE lt_queue INDEX 1.
      READ TABLE lt_fs_data INTO DATA(ls_fs_data3) WITH KEY step_id = lv_step_id.
      READ TABLE lt_distance INTO DATA(ls_distance) INDEX sy-tabix.
      ls_distance = ls_distance + ls_fs_data3-duration.
      MODIFY lt_distance INDEX sy-tabix FROM ls_distance.

      " Update in-degree and distance of all adjacent nodes
      LOOP AT lt_graph INTO DATA(ls_graph).
        IF ls_graph-from_step = lv_step_id.
          READ TABLE lt_in_degree INTO DATA(ls_in_degree3) WITH KEY table_line = ls_graph-to_step.
          ls_in_degree3 = ls_in_degree3 - 1.
          MODIFY lt_in_degree INDEX sy-tabix FROM ls_in_degree3.
          IF ls_in_degree3 = 0.
            APPEND ls_graph-to_step TO lt_queue.
          ENDIF.
          READ TABLE lt_distance INTO DATA(ls_distance2) WITH KEY table_line = ls_graph-to_step.
          IF ls_distance > ls_distance2.
            ls_distance2 = ls_distance.
            MODIFY lt_distance INDEX sy-tabix FROM ls_distance2.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.

    " Find the maximum distance
    LOOP AT lt_distance INTO DATA(ls_distance3).
      IF ls_distance3 > lv_max_duration.
        lv_max_duration = ls_distance3.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    rv_total_duration = lv_max_duration.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_step,
             step_id TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
             duration TYPE zfs_data-duration,
             dependencies TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id WITH EMPTY KEY,
           END OF ty_step.

    DATA: lt_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_step,
          ls_step LIKE LINE OF lt_steps,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i.

    " Populate steps table
    LOOP AT it_fs_data INTO DATA(ls_fs_data).
      ls_step-step_id = ls_fs_data-step_id.
      ls_step-duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      APPEND ls_step TO lt_steps.
      CLEAR ls_step.

      ENDIF.

      DATA(lt_dependencies) = ls_step-dependencies.

  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    DATA: lt_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lt_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lt_graph TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_edge,
          ls_fs_data LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
          ls_fnet_data LIKE LINE OF it_fnet_data,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i,
          lv_current_duration TYPE i,
          lt_visited TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char10.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_edge,
             from_step TYPE abap_char10,
             to_step TYPE abap_char10,
           END OF ty_edge.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_data> LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
                   <fnet_data> LIKE LINE OF it_fnet_data.

    lt_fs_data = it_fs_data.
    lt_fnet_data = it_fnet_data.

    LOOP AT lt_fnet_data ASSIGNING <fnet_data>.
      APPEND VALUE #( from_step = <fnet_data>-from_step to_step = <fnet_data>-to_step ) TO lt_graph.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT lt_fs_data ASSIGNING <fs_data>.
      lv_current_duration = <fs_data>-duration.
      lt_visited = VALUE #( ( <fs_data>-step_id ) ).

      PERFORM dfs USING <fs_data>-step_id lt_graph lt_fs_data lt_visited CHANGING lv_current_duration.

      IF lv_current_duration > lv_max_duration.
        lv_max_duration = lv_current_duration.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    rv_total_duration = lv_max_duration.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

FORM dfs USING iv_step_id TYPE abap_char10
                  it_graph TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_edge
                  it_fs_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data
                  it_visited TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF abap_char10
                  CHANGING cv_current_duration TYPE i.
  DATA: lv_duration TYPE i,
        lv_max_duration TYPE i,
        lt_edges TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_edge,
        ls_edge LIKE LINE OF lt_edges,
        ls_fs_data LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
        lv_step_id TYPE abap_char10.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_data> LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
                 <edge> LIKE LINE OF it_graph.

  LOOP AT it_graph ASSIGNING <edge> WHERE from_step = iv_step_id.
    lv_step_id = <edge>-to_step.
    READ TABLE it_visited WITH KEY table_line = lv_step_id TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      APPEND lv_step_id TO it_visited.
      READ TABLE it_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data WITH KEY step_id = lv_step_id.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        cv_current_duration = cv_current_duration + ls_fs_data-duration.
        PERFORM dfs USING lv_step_id it_graph it_fs_data it_visited CHANGING cv_current_duration.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_step,
             step_id TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
             duration TYPE zfs_data-duration,
             dependencies TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id WITH EMPTY KEY,
           END OF ty_step.

    DATA: lt_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_step,
          ls_step  LIKE LINE OF lt_steps,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i.

    " Populate steps table
    LOOP AT it_fs_data INTO DATA(ls_fs_data).
      ls_step-step_id = ls_fs_data-step_id.
      ls_step-duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      APPEND ls_step TO lt_steps.
      CLEAR ls_step.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Populate dependencies
    LOOP AT it_fnet_data INTO DATA(ls_fnet_data).
      READ TABLE lt_steps INTO ls_step WITH KEY step_id = ls_fnet_data-to_step.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        APPEND ls_fnet_data-from_step TO ls_step-dependencies.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Topological sorting
    DATA: lt_sorted_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_step,
          lt_visited_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id WITH EMPTY KEY.

    PERFORM topological_sort USING lt_steps lt_sorted_steps lt_visited_steps.

    " Calculate total duration
    DATA: lt_durations TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i WITH EMPTY KEY.

    LOOP AT lt_sorted_steps INTO ls_step.
      DATA(lv_max_dependency_duration) = 0.
      LOOP AT ls_step-dependencies INTO DATA(lv_dependency).
        READ TABLE lt_durations INTO DATA(lv_dependency_duration) WITH KEY table_line = lv_dependency.
        IF sy-subrc = 0 AND lv_dependency_duration > lv_max_dependency_duration.
          lv_max_dependency_duration = lv_dependency_duration.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      APPEND ls_step-duration + lv_max_dependency_duration TO lt_durations USING KEY ls_step-step_id.
    ENDLOOP.

    SORT lt_durations DESCENDING.
    READ TABLE lt_durations INTO lv_total_duration INDEX 1.

    rv_total_duration = lv_total_duration.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

FORM topological_sort
  USING
    it_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_step
    ct_sorted_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_step
    ct_visited_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id.

  DATA: ls_step LIKE LINE OF it_steps.

  LOOP AT it_steps INTO ls_step.
    IF NOT line_exists( ct_visited_steps[ table_line = ls_step-step_id ] ).
      PERFORM visit_step USING ls_step ct_sorted_steps ct_visited_steps it_steps.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.

ENDFORM.

FORM visit_step
  USING
    is_step TYPE ty_step
    ct_sorted_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_step
    ct_visited_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id
    it_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_step.

  DATA: ls_dependency LIKE LINE OF is_step-dependencies.

  APPEND is_step-step_id TO ct_visited_steps.

  LOOP AT is_step-dependencies INTO ls_dependency.
    READ TABLE it_steps INTO DATA(ls_dependency_step) WITH KEY step_id = ls_dependency.
    IF sy-subrc = 0 AND NOT line_exists( ct_visited_steps[ table_line = ls_dependency ] ).
      PERFORM visit_step USING ls_dependency_step ct_sorted_steps ct_visited_steps it_steps.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.

  APPEND is_step TO ct_sorted_steps.

ENDFORM.

        IMPORTING

        RETURNING

CLASS lcl_production_process IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_total_duration.
    DATA: lt_fs_data  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data,
          lt_fnet_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfnet_data,
          lv_total_duration TYPE i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i,
          lt_step_durations TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i,
          ls_fs_data LIKE LINE OF it_fs_data,
          ls_fnet_data LIKE LINE OF it_fnet_data.

    lt_fs_data = it_fs_data.
    lt_fnet_data = it_fnet_data.

    " Create a dictionary to store the dependencies of each step
    DATA: lt_dependencies TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_dependencies,
          ls_dependencies LIKE LINE OF lt_dependencies.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_dependencies,
             step_id TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
             dependencies TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id,
           END OF ty_dependencies.

    LOOP AT lt_fnet_data INTO ls_fnet_data.
      READ TABLE lt_dependencies INTO ls_dependencies WITH KEY step_id = ls_fnet_data-to_step.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        ls_dependencies-step_id = ls_fnet_data-to_step.
        APPEND ls_fnet_data-from_step TO ls_dependencies-dependencies.
        APPEND ls_dependencies TO lt_dependencies.
      ELSE.
        APPEND ls_fnet_data-from_step TO ls_dependencies-dependencies.
        MODIFY TABLE lt_dependencies FROM ls_dependencies.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Create a dictionary to store the duration of each step
    DATA: lt_durations TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_durations,
          ls_durations LIKE LINE OF lt_durations.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_durations,
             step_id TYPE zfs_data-step_id,
             duration TYPE zfs_data-duration,
           END OF ty_durations.

    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      ls_durations-step_id = ls_fs_data-step_id.
      ls_durations-duration = ls_fs_data-duration.
      APPEND ls_durations TO lt_durations.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Perform topological sorting
    DATA: lt_sorted_steps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id,
          ls_sorted_step LIKE LINE OF lt_sorted_steps,
          lt_in_degree TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i,
          lv_in_degree TYPE i.

    LOOP AT lt_fs_data INTO ls_fs_data.
      APPEND ls_fs_data-step_id TO lt_sorted_steps.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT lt_fnet_data INTO ls_fnet_data.
      READ TABLE lt_in_degree INTO lv_in_degree WITH KEY table_line = ls_fnet_data-to_step.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        lv_in_degree = 1.
        APPEND ls_fnet_data-to_step TO lt_in_degree.
      ELSE.
        lv_in_degree = lv_in_degree + 1.
        MODIFY TABLE lt_in_degree FROM ls_fnet_data-to_step.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    DATA: lt_queue TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zfs_data-step_id,
          ls_queue LIKE LINE OF lt_queue.

    LOOP AT lt_sorted_steps INTO ls_sorted_step.
      READ TABLE lt_in_degree INTO lv_in_degree WITH KEY table_line = ls_sorted_step.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR lv_in_degree = 0.
        APPEND ls_sorted_step TO lt_queue.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    WHILE lt_queue IS NOT INITIAL.
      DATA: ls_current_step LIKE LINE OF lt_queue.
      ls_current_step = lt_queue[ 1 ].
      DELETE lt_queue INDEX 1.

      " Update the duration of the current step
      READ TABLE lt_durations INTO ls_durations WITH KEY step_id = ls_current_step.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        lv_max_duration = ls_durations-duration.
      ENDIF.

      " Update the in-degree of the neighboring steps
      LOOP AT lt_fnet_data INTO ls_fnet_data.
        IF ls_fnet_data-from_step = ls_current_step.
          READ TABLE lt_in_degree INTO lv_in_degree WITH KEY table_line = ls_fnet_data-to_step.
          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            lv_in_degree = lv_in_degree - 1.
            MODIFY TABLE lt_in_degree FROM ls_fnet_data-to_step.
            IF lv_in_degree = 0.
              APPEND ls_fnet_data-to_step TO lt_queue.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.

      " Update the total duration
      lv_total_duration = lv_total_duration + ls_durations-duration.
    ENDWHILE.

    rv_total_duration = lv_total_duration.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

    WHILE lt_sorted_steps IS INITIAL OR lines( lt_sorted_steps ) < lines( lt_steps ).
      LOOP AT lt_steps INTO ls_step.
        IF NOT line_exists( lt_visited_steps[ table_line = ls_step-step_id ] ) AND
           NOT line_exists( lt_sorted_steps[ table_line = ls_step-step_id ] ).
          IF lines( ls_step-dependencies ) = 0.
            APPEND ls_step-step_id TO lt_sorted_steps.
            APPEND ls_step-step_id TO lt_visited_steps.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.

      IF lines( lt_sorted_steps ) = lines( lt_steps ).
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.

      LOOP AT lt_steps INTO ls_step.
        IF NOT line_exists( lt_visited_steps[ table_line = ls_step-step_id ] ) AND
           NOT line_exists( lt_sorted_steps[ table_line = ls_step-step_id ] ).
          DATA(lt_unvisited_dependencies) = VALUE #( lt_steps[ step_id = ls_step-dependencies[ table_line ] ]-step_id DEFAULT 'X' IF NOT line_exists( lt_visited_steps[ table_line = ls_step-dependencies[ table_line ] ] ) ).
          IF lines( lt_unvisited_dependencies ) = 0.
            APPEND ls_step-step_id TO lt_sorted_steps.
            APPEND ls_step-step_id TO lt_visited_steps.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.

    " Calculate total duration using dynamic programming
    DATA: lt_durations TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i,
          lv_max_duration TYPE i.

    LOOP AT lt_sorted_steps INTO lv_current_step.
      READ TABLE lt_steps INTO ls_step WITH KEY step_id = lv_current_step.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        lv_max_duration = ls_step-duration.
        LOOP AT ls_step-dependencies INTO DATA(lv_dependency).
          READ TABLE lt_durations INTO DATA(lv_dependency_duration) INDEX sy-tabix.
          IF sy-subrc = 0 AND lv_dependency_duration > lv_max_duration.
            lv_max_duration = lv_dependency_duration.
          ENDIF.
        ENDLOOP.
        APPEND lv_max_duration TO lt_durations.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    rv_total_duration = REDUCE i( INIT val = 0 FOR ls_duration IN lt_durations NEXT val = val + ls_duration ).

  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt

CLASS lcl_stock_calculator DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      calculate_available_stock
        IMPORTING
          mat_id            TYPE abap_char(20)
        RETURNING
          VALUE(current_amount) TYPE ztransaction.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_stock_calculator IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_available_stock.
    DATA: lt_transactions TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ztransaction,
          lv_current_stock TYPE abap_int4,
          lv_shortage      TYPE abap_int4,
          lv_date          TYPE abap_dats,
          ls_current_amount TYPE ztransaction.

    " Get current stock
    SELECT SINGLE stock FROM zstock INTO lv_current_stock WHERE mat_id = mat_id.

    " Get transactions for material
    SELECT * FROM ztransaction INTO TABLE lt_transactions WHERE mat_id = mat_id ORDER BY transaction_date.

    " Simulate stock over time
    LOOP AT lt_transactions INTO DATA(ls_transaction).
      lv_current_stock = lv_current_stock + ls_transaction-amount.

      " Check for shortage
      IF lv_current_stock < 0.
        lv_shortage = abs( lv_current_stock ).
        lv_date = ls_transaction-transaction_date.

        " Create new planning order
        ls_current_amount-id = 99999.
        ls_current_amount-mat_id = mat_id.
        ls_current_amount-transaction_type = 'PLO'.
        ls_current_amount-transaction_date = lv_date.
        ls_current_amount-amount = lv_shortage.

        " Update current stock
        lv_current_stock = 0.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Return newly created PLO if one was created
    IF ls_current_amount-id = 99999.
      current_amount = ls_current_amount.
    ELSE.
      CLEAR current_amount.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_material_delivery DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      calculate_delivery_date
        IMPORTING
          iv_order_date TYPE dats
          iv_mat_id     TYPE string
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_delivery_date) TYPE dats.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_material_delivery IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_delivery_date.
    DATA: lt_material TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmaterial,
          lt_holiday  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zholiday,
          lv_lead_time_days TYPE i,
          lv_order_date TYPE dats,
          lv_delivery_date TYPE dats,
          lv_current_date TYPE dats.

    lv_order_date = iv_order_date.

    SELECT * FROM zmaterial INTO TABLE @lt_material.
    READ TABLE lt_material INTO DATA(ls_material) WITH KEY mat_id = iv_mat_id.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      lv_lead_time_days = 0.
    ELSE.
      lv_lead_time_days = ls_material-lead_time_days.
    ENDIF.

    SELECT * FROM zholiday INTO TABLE @lt_holiday.

    lv_current_date = lv_order_date.
    DO lv_lead_time_days TIMES.
      lv_current_date = lv_current_date + 1.
      WHILE lv_current_date MOD 7 >= 6 OR line_exists( lt_holiday[ holiday_date = lv_current_date ] ).
        lv_current_date = lv_current_date + 1.
      ENDWHILE.
    ENDDO.

    rv_delivery_date = lv_current_date.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_material_delivery IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD calculate_delivery_date.
    DATA: lt_material TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmaterial,
          lt_holiday  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zholiday,
          lv_lead_time_days TYPE i,
          lv_current_date TYPE dats,
          lv_day TYPE i,
          lv_weekday TYPE i,
          lv_holiday TYPE abap_bool.

    SELECT * FROM zmaterial INTO TABLE @lt_material.
    SELECT * FROM zholiday INTO TABLE @lt_holiday.

    READ TABLE lt_material INTO DATA(ls_material) WITH KEY mat_id = iv_mat_id.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      lv_lead_time_days = 0.
    ELSE.
      lv_lead_time_days = ls_material-lead_time_days.
    ENDIF.

    lv_current_date = iv_order_date.
    DO lv_lead_time_days TIMES.
      lv_current_date = lv_current_date + 1.
      lv_day = lv_current_date+6(2).
      lv_weekday = lv_current_date+0(4) MOD 7.
      IF lv_weekday = 6 OR lv_weekday = 7.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.
      READ TABLE lt_holiday INTO DATA(ls_holiday) WITH KEY holiday_date = lv_current_date.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.
    ENDDO.

    rv_delivery_date = lv_current_date.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
