ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

CLASS lcl_customer_id_generator DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      generate_customer_id
        IMPORTING
          iv_country     TYPE abap_char(50)
          iv_region      TYPE abap_char(100)
          iv_customer_type TYPE abap_char(30)
          iv_digit_id    TYPE i
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_customer_id) TYPE string.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_customer_id_generator IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD generate_customer_id.
    DATA: lv_country_code TYPE abap_char(4),
          lv_region_code  TYPE abap_char(2),
          lv_type_code    TYPE abap_char(1),
          lv_id           TYPE string.

    " Trim input parameters
    DATA(lv_country) = to_upper( val = iv_country ).
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_country WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_region) = to_upper( val = iv_region ).
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_region WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_customer_type) = to_upper( val = iv_customer_type ).
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_customer_type WITH ''.

    " Map country codes
    CASE lv_country.
      WHEN 'GERMANY'.
        lv_country_code = '0049'.
      WHEN 'AUSTRIA'.
        lv_country_code = '0043'.
      WHEN 'SWITZERLAND'.
        lv_country_code = '0041'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_country_code = 'XXXX'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Derive regional abbreviations
    SPLIT lv_region AT space INTO TABLE DATA(lt_region_words).
    DATA(lv_region_abbreviation) = ''.
    LOOP AT lt_region_words INTO DATA(lv_word).
      lv_region_abbreviation = lv_region_abbreviation && left( val = to_upper( lv_word+0(1) ) len = 1 ).
      IF strlen( lv_region_abbreviation ) = 2.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lv_region_abbreviation IS INITIAL.
      lv_region_abbreviation = 'XX'.
    ENDIF.
    lv_region_code = lv_region_abbreviation.

    " Map customer types
    CASE lv_customer_type.
      WHEN 'BUSINESS_CUSTOMER'.
        lv_type_code = 'B'.
      WHEN 'PRIVATE_CUSTOMER'.
        lv_type_code = 'P'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_type_code = 'X'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Format ID number
    lv_id = |{ iv_digit_id RIGHT:5 PAD = '0' }|.

    " Construct customer ID
    rv_customer_id = lv_country_code && lv_region_code && lv_type_code && lv_id.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_customer_id_generator IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD generate_customer_id.
    DATA: lv_country_code TYPE abap_char(4),
          lv_region_code  TYPE abap_char(2),
          lv_type_code    TYPE abap_char(1),
          lv_id           TYPE string.

    " Trim input parameters
    DATA(lv_country) = to_upper( val = iv_country ).
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_country WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_region) = to_upper( val = iv_region ).
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_region WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_customer_type) = to_upper( val = iv_customer_type ).
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_customer_type WITH ''.

    " Determine country code
    CASE lv_country.
      WHEN 'GERMANY'.
        lv_country_code = '0049'.
      WHEN 'AUSTRIA'.
        lv_country_code = '0043'.
      WHEN 'SWITZERLAND'.
        lv_country_code = '0041'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_country_code = 'XXXX'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Determine regional abbreviation
    SPLIT lv_region AT space INTO TABLE DATA(lt_region_words).
    DATA(lv_abbreviation) = ''.
    LOOP AT lt_region_words INTO DATA(lv_word).
      IF lv_abbreviation IS INITIAL.
        lv_abbreviation = lv_word+0(1).
      ELSEIF strlen( lv_abbreviation ) < 2.
        lv_abbreviation = lv_abbreviation && lv_word+0(1).
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lv_abbreviation IS INITIAL.
      lv_region_code = 'XX'.
    ELSE.
      lv_region_code = to_upper( val = lv_abbreviation ).
    ENDIF.

    " Determine customer type code
    CASE lv_customer_type.
      WHEN 'BUSINESS_CUSTOMER'.
        lv_type_code = 'B'.
      WHEN 'PRIVATE_CUSTOMER'.
        lv_type_code = 'P'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_type_code = 'X'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Format ID number
    lv_id = iv_digit_id.
    CONDENSE lv_id.
    lv_id = |{ lv_id RIGHT:5 PAD = '0' }|.

    " Construct customer ID
    rv_customer_id = |{ lv_country_code }{ lv_region_code }{ lv_type_code }{ lv_id }|.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.

CLASS lcl_customer_id_generator DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      generate_customer_id
        IMPORTING
          iv_country     TYPE abap_char(50)
          iv_region      TYPE abap_char(100)
          iv_customer_type TYPE abap_char(30)
          iv_digit_id    TYPE i
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_customer_id) TYPE string.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_customer_id_generator IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD generate_customer_id.
    DATA: lv_country_code TYPE abap_char(4),
          lv_region_code  TYPE abap_char(2),
          lv_type_code    TYPE abap_char(1),
          lv_id           TYPE string.

    " Trim input parameters
    DATA(lv_country) = iv_country.
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_country WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_region) = iv_region.
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_region WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_customer_type) = iv_customer_type.
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_customer_type WITH ''.

    " Determine country code
    CASE lv_country.
      WHEN 'Germany'.
        lv_country_code = '0049'.
      WHEN 'Austria'.
        lv_country_code = '0043'.
      WHEN 'Switzerland'.
        lv_country_code = '0041'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_country_code = 'XXXX'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Determine regional abbreviation
    SPLIT lv_region AT space INTO TABLE DATA(lt_region_words).
    IF lines( lt_region_words ) > 0.
      lv_region_code = lt_region_words[ 1+0 ](1).
      IF lines( lt_region_words ) > 1.
        lv_region_code = lv_region_code && lt_region_words[ 1+1 ](1).
      ENDIF.
      TRANSLATE lv_region_code TO UPPER CASE.
    ELSE.
      lv_region_code = 'XX'.
    ENDIF.

    " Determine customer type code
    CASE lv_customer_type.
      WHEN 'Business_Customer'.
        lv_type_code = 'B'.
      WHEN 'Private_Customer'.
        lv_type_code = 'P'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_type_code = 'X'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Format ID number
    WRITE iv_digit_id TO lv_id LEFT JUSTIFIED.
    CONDENSE lv_id NO-GAPS.
    lv_id = lv_id && repeat( val = '0' occ = 5 - strlen( lv_id ) ).

    " Construct customer ID
    rv_customer_id = lv_country_code && lv_region_code && lv_type_code && lv_id.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_customer_id_generator DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      generate_customer_id
        IMPORTING
          iv_country     TYPE abap_char(50)
          iv_region      TYPE abap_char(100)
          iv_customer_type TYPE abap_char(30)
          iv_digit_id    TYPE i
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rv_customer_id) TYPE string.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_customer_id_generator IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD generate_customer_id.
    DATA: lv_country_code TYPE abap_char(4),
          lv_region_code  TYPE abap_char(2),
          lv_type_code    TYPE abap_char(1),
          lv_id           TYPE string.

    " Trim input parameters
    DATA(lv_country) = iv_country.
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_country WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_region) = iv_region.
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_region WITH ''.
    DATA(lv_customer_type) = iv_customer_type.
    REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[[:space:]]' IN lv_customer_type WITH ''.

    " Determine country code
    CASE lv_country.
      WHEN 'Germany'.
        lv_country_code = '0049'.
      WHEN 'Austria'.
        lv_country_code = '0043'.
      WHEN 'Switzerland'.
        lv_country_code = '0041'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_country_code = 'XXXX'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Determine regional abbreviation
    SPLIT lv_region AT space INTO TABLE DATA(lt_region_words).
    DATA(lv_region_abbreviation) = ''.
    LOOP AT lt_region_words INTO DATA(lv_word).
      IF strlen( lv_region_abbreviation ) < 2.
        lv_region_abbreviation = lv_region_abbreviation && substr( val = lv_word+0(1) len = 1 ).
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lv_region_abbreviation IS INITIAL.
      lv_region_abbreviation = 'XX'.
    ENDIF.
    lv_region_code = lv_region_abbreviation.

    " Determine customer type code
    CASE lv_customer_type.
      WHEN 'Business_Customer'.
        lv_type_code = 'B'.
      WHEN 'Private_Customer'.
        lv_type_code = 'P'.
      OTHERS.
        lv_type_code = 'X'.
    ENDCASE.

    " Format ID number
    WRITE iv_digit_id TO lv_id LEFT.
    CONDENSE lv_id.
    lv_id = lv_id && repeat( val = '0' times = 5 - strlen( lv_id ) ).

    " Construct customer ID
    rv_customer_id = lv_country_code && lv_region_code && lv_type_code && lv_id.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

CLASS lcl_sales_aggregator DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS: aggregate_revenue.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_sales_aggregator IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD aggregate_revenue.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_sales_position,
             zid   TYPE zsales_positions-zid,
             zname TYPE zsales_positions-zname,
             zarticle TYPE zsales_positions-zarticle,
             zcurrency TYPE zsales_positions-zcurrency,
             zrev TYPE zsales_positions-zrev,
           END OF ty_sales_position.

    DATA: lt_sales_positions TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_sales_position,
          lt_sales_aggr TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zsales_aggr.

    SELECT * FROM zsales_positions INTO TABLE @lt_sales_positions.

    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    DELETE FROM zsales_aggr.

    LOOP AT lt_sales_positions INTO DATA(ls_sales_position).
      DATA(ls_sales_aggr) = VALUE zsales_aggr( zname = ls_sales_position-zname
                                               zarticle = ls_sales_position-zarticle
                                               zcurrency = ls_sales_position-zcurrency ).

      READ TABLE lt_sales_aggr INTO DATA(ls_existing_aggr) WITH KEY zname = ls_sales_aggr-zname
                                                                        zarticle = ls_sales_aggr-zarticle
                                                                        zcurrency = ls_sales_aggr-zcurrency.

      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        ls_existing_aggr-zrev = ls_existing_aggr-zrev + ls_sales_position-zrev.
        MODIFY TABLE lt_sales_aggr FROM ls_existing_aggr.
      ELSE.
        ls_sales_aggr-zrev = ls_sales_position-zrev.
        INSERT ls_sales_aggr INTO TABLE lt_sales_aggr.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    INSERT zsales_aggr FROM TABLE @lt_sales_aggr.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_sales_aggr,

             zcurrency TYPE zsales_aggr-zcurrency,

    DELETE FROM zsales_aggr.

      DATA(ls_sales_aggr) = VALUE ty_sales_aggr(
        zname     = ls_sales_position-zname
        zarticle  = ls_sales_position-zarticle
        zcurrency = ls_sales_position-zcurrency
        zrev      = ls_sales_position-zrev ).

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

Implement a global ABAP class with a static method that runs a customer search. It should accept a partial customer_id or name and return matching full records from the database. The search should be case insensitive.
Use this database table:
define table zcustomer {
    key customer_id : abap.numc(10);
    name : abap.char(50); 
}

Example:
Input:
INSERT VALUE #( customer_id = '0000000001' name = 'John Smith' ) INTO zcustomer.
INSERT VALUE #( customer_id = '0000000002' name = 'Alice Johnson' ) INTO zcustomer.
INSERT VALUE #( customer_id = '0000000003' name = 'Robert Martin' ) INTO zcustomer.
Output:
DATA(results) = zcl_customer_search=>find_by_pattern( iv_pattern = 'John' ).
LOOP AT results INTO DATA(row).
  WRITE: / row-kundennr, row-name. 
ENDLOOP.
" This should find ( customer_id = '0000000001' name = 'John Smith' ) and ( customer_id = '0000000002' name = 'Alice Johnson' )

CLASS zcl_customer_search DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      find_by_pattern
        IMPORTING
          iv_pattern        TYPE string
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rt_results) TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zcustomer.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_customer_search IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD find_by_pattern.
    DATA: lv_pattern TYPE string.
    lv_pattern = to_upper( iv_pattern ).
    SELECT * FROM zcustomer
      INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE rt_results
      WHERE to_upper( customer_id ) LIKE '%' && lv_pattern && '%'
        OR to_upper( name ) LIKE '%' && lv_pattern && '%'.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

CLASS lcl_flight_search DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      get_available_flights
        IMPORTING
          origin_city      TYPE char20
          destination_city TYPE char20
          flight_date      TYPE dats
        RETURNING
          VALUE(result) TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_flight.
ENDCLASS.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_flight,
         airline_name TYPE scarr-carrname,
         departure_city TYPE spfli-cityfrom,
         destination TYPE spfli-cityto,
         flight_time TYPE spfli-fltime,
         available_seats TYPE i,
       END OF ty_flight.

CLASS lcl_flight_search IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_available_flights.
    DATA: lt_spfli TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF spfli,
          lt_sflight TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF sflight,
          lt_scarr TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF scarr.

    SELECT * FROM spfli INTO TABLE @lt_spfli
      WHERE cityfrom = @origin_city AND cityto = @destination_city.

    SELECT * FROM sflight INTO TABLE @lt_sflight
      WHERE carrid = @lt_spfli[ 1 ]-carrid AND connid = @lt_spfli[ 1 ]-connid AND fldate = @flight_date.

    SELECT * FROM scarr INTO TABLE @lt_scarr
      WHERE carrid = @lt_sflight[ 1 ]-carrid.

    LOOP AT lt_spfli INTO DATA(ls_spfli).
      SELECT * FROM sflight INTO TABLE @lt_sflight
        WHERE carrid = @ls_spfli-carrid AND connid = @ls_spfli-connid AND fldate = @flight_date.

      LOOP AT lt_sflight INTO DATA(ls_sflight).
        IF ls_sflight-seatsmax - ls_sflight-seatsocc > 0.
          SELECT SINGLE * FROM scarr INTO @DATA(ls_scarr)
            WHERE carrid = @ls_sflight-carrid.

          APPEND VALUE #(
            airline_name = ls_scarr-carrname
            departure_city = ls_spfli-cityfrom
            destination = ls_spfli-cityto
            flight_time = ls_spfli-fltime
            available_seats = ls_sflight-seatsmax - ls_sflight-seatsocc
          ) TO result.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt
You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

Always respond with both the class definition and implementation code. 
Only respond with the code. Do not include any explanations or comments.

CLASS lcl_flight_search DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      get_available_flights
        IMPORTING
          origin_city      TYPE char20
          destination_city TYPE char20
          flight_date      TYPE dats
        RETURNING
          VALUE(result) TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_flight_info.
ENDCLASS.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_flight_info,
         airline_name TYPE scarr-carrname,
         departure_city TYPE spfli-cityfrom,
         destination TYPE spfli-cityto,
         flight_time TYPE spfli-fltime,
         available_seats TYPE i,
       END OF ty_flight_info.

CLASS lcl_flight_search IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_available_flights.
    DATA: lt_sflight TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF sflight,
          lt_spfli  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF spfli,
          lt_scarr  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF scarr.

    SELECT * FROM sflight INTO TABLE lt_sflight
      WHERE carrid = 'LH' OR carrid = 'AF'
      AND fldate = flight_date.

    SELECT * FROM spfli INTO TABLE lt_spfli
      WHERE cityfrom = origin_city AND cityto = destination_city.

    SELECT * FROM scarr INTO TABLE lt_scarr
      FOR ALL ENTRIES IN lt_spfli
      WHERE carrid = lt_spfli-carrid.

    LOOP AT lt_spfli INTO DATA(ls_spfli).
      READ TABLE lt_sflight INTO DATA(ls_sflight)
        WITH KEY carrid = ls_spfli-carrid connid = ls_spfli-connid fldate = flight_date.
      IF sy-subrc = 0 AND ls_sflight-seatsmax - ls_sflight-seatsocc > 0.
        READ TABLE lt_scarr INTO DATA(ls_scarr)
          WITH KEY carrid = ls_spfli-carrid.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          APPEND VALUE #(
            airline_name   = ls_scarr-carrname
            departure_city = ls_spfli-cityfrom
            destination    = ls_spfli-cityto
            flight_time    = ls_spfli-fltime
            available_seats = ls_sflight-seatsmax - ls_sflight-seatsocc
          ) TO result.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_flight_search IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_available_flights.
    DATA: lt_spfli TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF spfli,
          lt_sflight TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF sflight,
          lt_scarr TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF scarr.

      FOR ALL ENTRIES IN lt_sflight
      WHERE carrid = lt_sflight-carrid.

    LOOP AT lt_sflight ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_sflight>).
      DATA: ls_spfli LIKE LINE OF lt_spfli,
            ls_scarr LIKE LINE OF lt_scarr.

                        departure_city = ls_spfli-cityfrom
                        destination = ls_spfli-cityto

ABAP Class Generation System Prompt

CLASS lcl_revenue DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      get_total_revenue_by_airline
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rt_result) TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_revenue.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_revenue,
             carrname TYPE scarr-carrname,
             total_revenue TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
           END OF ty_revenue.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_revenue IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_total_revenue_by_airline.
    DATA: lt_sbook TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF sbook,
          lt_scarr TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF scarr,
          lt_result TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_revenue.

    SELECT * FROM sbook INTO TABLE @lt_sbook.
    SELECT * FROM scarr INTO TABLE @lt_scarr.

    LOOP AT lt_scarr INTO DATA(ls_scarr).
      DATA(lv_total_revenue) = 0.
      LOOP AT lt_sbook INTO DATA(ls_sbook) WHERE carrid = ls_scarr-carrid.
        lv_total_revenue = lv_total_revenue + ls_sbook-forcuram.
      ENDLOOP.
      APPEND VALUE #( carrname = ls_scarr-carrname total_revenue = lv_total_revenue ) TO lt_result.
    ENDLOOP.

    rt_result = lt_result.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

You are an expert ABAP developer specializing in generating high-quality ABAP classes for SAP systems.
You write global ABAP classes with static methods.

System Environment
SAP Version: NetWeaver 7.57 (S/4HANA 2022)
Decimal Separator: Always use . (period) as decimal separator in numeric literals

CLASS lcl_revenue DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      get_total_revenue_by_airline
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rt_result) TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_result.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_result,
             carrname TYPE scarr-carrname,
             total_revenue TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
           END OF ty_result.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_revenue IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_total_revenue_by_airline.
    DATA: lt_sbook TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF sbook,
          lt_scarr TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF scarr,
          lt_result TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_result.

    SELECT * FROM sbook INTO TABLE @lt_sbook.
    SELECT * FROM scarr INTO TABLE @lt_scarr.

    LOOP AT lt_scarr INTO DATA(ls_scarr).
      DATA(lv_total_revenue) = 0.
      LOOP AT lt_sbook INTO DATA(ls_sbook) WHERE carrid = ls_scarr-carrid.
        lv_total_revenue = lv_total_revenue + ls_sbook-forcuram.
      ENDLOOP.
      APPEND VALUE #( carrname = ls_scarr-carrname total_revenue = lv_total_revenue ) TO lt_result.
    ENDLOOP.

    rt_result = lt_result.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_route_analysis DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      get_route_profitability
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rt_route_revenue) TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_route_revenue.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_route_revenue,
             cityfrom   TYPE spfli-cityfrom,
             cityto     TYPE spfli-cityto,
             total_revenue TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
           END OF ty_route_revenue.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_route_analysis IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_route_profitability.
    DATA: lt_sflight TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF sflight,
          lt_spfli   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF spfli,
          lt_route_revenue TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_route_revenue.

    SELECT * FROM sflight INTO TABLE lt_sflight.
    SELECT * FROM spfli INTO TABLE lt_spfli.

    LOOP AT lt_sflight ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_sflight>).
      READ TABLE lt_spfli ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_spfli>) WITH KEY carrid = <ls_sflight>-carrid connid = <ls_sflight>-connid.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        DATA(ls_route_revenue) = VALUE ty_route_revenue( cityfrom = <ls_spfli>-cityfrom cityto = <ls_spfli>-cityto total_revenue = <ls_sflight>-price * <ls_sflight>-seatsocc ).
        READ TABLE lt_route_revenue WITH KEY cityfrom = ls_route_revenue-cityfrom cityto = ls_route_revenue-cityto ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_route_revenue>).
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          <ls_route_revenue>-total_revenue = <ls_route_revenue>-total_revenue + ls_route_revenue-total_revenue.
        ELSE.
          INSERT ls_route_revenue INTO TABLE lt_route_revenue.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    SORT lt_route_revenue BY total_revenue DESCENDING.
    rt_route_revenue = lt_route_revenue.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
